title: (x) Jim Manzie serif face w/ ornate caps - Bookman Swash {James}
content: Does anyone know what font this is and/or if something similar is available digitally (this is a letterpress piece). I'm looking for an easy to set serif face with larger, just slightly ornamental caps (like these) with a regular lower case. thank you! ![manzie](http://web.archive.org/web/20050528000740im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/70583.jpg)
author: dcolombyverizonnet

comments.content: Ooops! I don't mean regular lower case - I mean small caps, such as these.

See [this thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20050528000740/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/24826.html?1075527026) for more information (there's lots of good stuff there). Those don't look like small caps but rather regular caps with the swash capitals. [This](http://web.archive.org/web/20050528000740/http:/www.fonts.com/FindFonts/detail.htm?pid=415678&ovmkt=JK0U0JDQ41GISCA7JS1RID2DCS) is similar and may suit your needs.
